content.text: table is designed to store historical billing data related to Con Edison accounts. This table captures various attributes of billing periods, including account details, billing amounts, and metadata about the upload process. It is part of a larger system that likely manages utility billing and account information, specifically for Con Edison, a major energy company.
The complexity of this table is considered medium due to the following factors:
It contains a moderate number of columns (24), which include a mix of data types and default values.
The table uses user-defined functions for default values, which adds a layer of complexity.
It has a single primary key and no explicitly defined foreign keys, suggesting it may be part of a larger schema with implicit relationships.

This table is used in the context of utility billing management. It serves to:
Track historical billing data for auditing and reporting purposes.
Provide a record of changes and updates to billing information over time.
Support customer service operations by allowing retrieval of past billing information.
Facilitate financial analysis and forecasting by maintaining historical billing records.
